thread.title: 1000 free meals up for grabs
thread.title_full: 1000 free meals up for grabs | News Local

author: Danielle Jarvis
title: 1000 free meals up for grabs
text:
Sarah Markham , Brea Stewart, Henry Lennon and James Zarb, of the new Fratelli Famous and The Bavarian which to open in Penrith. Picture: Justin Sanson Penrith 1000 free meals up for grabs Danielle Jarvis, Penrith Press February 8, 2017 5:44pm Kim’s passion for Penrith Cool off at new splash pad
Penrith is set for its biggest restaurant giveaway when Fratelli Famous and The Bavarian open under one roof on Monday.
To celebrate the opening of the dual venue, Fratelli Famous will serve up 500 free build-your-own pizzas while The Bavarian will offer 500 free hotdogs ­to customers who have ­followed the restaurants on ­social media.
Customers can queue up at the eatery on the ground floor of Penrith Plaza ­Westfield for the 1000-meal giveaway from 11.30am.
Fratelli Famous, the offshoot of up-market Italian restaurant Fratelli Fresh, and The Bavarian, a casual spin-off of the famous Bavarian Bier Cafe, will share a space divided by a bar.
The new venture brings with it around 35 jobs.
media_camera Sarah Markham, Brea Stewart, Henry Lennon and James Zarb, of the new Fratelli Famous and The Bavarian. Picture: Justin Sanson
The new 550sq m space will house 300 seats shared between the two restaurants and the bar, ensuring groups can move from formal dining to casual drinks without leaving the venue.
Thomas Pash, Rockpool Dining Group chief executive, said the shared venue would give people variety.
“It’s a great market for us,” Mr Pash said. “We launched this model at World Square. Customers get the best of Bavarian and the best of Italy.
media_camera Food and drink anyone? There will be 17 kinds of beer on tap.
“We are thrilled to be bringing our Famous pizzas and much-loved Bavarian fast-casual offering to Penrith, which will deliver quick, convenient and affordable dining options.”
Penrith Mayor John Thain said the new restaurants encourage more night-life in Penrith.
“The food culture is a growing culture in Penrith, I think it is becoming a hotspot,” he said.
“We have all the different choices that you have in the city.
“It’s really part of our drive to get the night-time economy going and the ­restaurants are responding to that.”
The Bavarian’s famous 17 kinds of beer on tap, both locally brewed and imported favourites will be available at the bar strategically situated in the centre.
media_camera The Bavarian will open in Penrith on Monday.
The Bavarian also boasts a mean schnitzel, house-made sausage, pork knuckle, chicken wings and build-your-own salads.
Fratelli Famous menu features pizzas for breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert as well as thickshakes, house-made icetea, Fratelli wines.
Creative patrons can design their own pizza by choosing thin and crispy, sourdough or gluten free crust, different sauces, cheese and seasonings and heaps of toppings - with one million different combinations available.
